revised_title: Plant Geography of Mt Kinabalu: A Discussion on the Results of the Royal Society Expedition to North Borneo
tldr: The author discusses the plant geography of Mt Kinabalu's mountain flora, focusing on its unique status as the only mountain over 4,000 meters in the region. They analyze the affinities between Kinabalu's flora and other mountains, considering both centric (evolved in situ) and eccentric (migrated from remote centers) species. The author also distinguishes between three zones on the mountain and discusses the dispersal and distribution of various plant species.
